DoingBusinessAsName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: GREAT LAKES CENTER FOR AUTISM TREATMENT & RESEARCH

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: WE PARTNER WITH CHILDREN AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES AND THEIR FAMILIES SO THEY MAY LIVE MORE MEANINGFUL, HEALTHY, AND INDEPENDENT LIVES IN THEIR HOMES AND COMMUNITIES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: WE PARTNER WITH CHILDREN AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES AND THEIR FAMILIES SO THEY MAY LIVE MORE MEANINGFUL, HEALTHY, AND INDEPENDENT LIVES IN THEIR HOMES AND COMMUNITIES.
IRS990.Desc: GROUP HOMESOUR LICENSED HOMES ARE DESIGNED TO HELP ADULTS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES LIVE IN AN ATTRACTIVE HOME SETTING, IN A SAFE NEIGHBORHOOD, WHERE THEY CAN ENJOY THE COMMUNITY AS WELL AS RECEIVE ASSISTANCE WITH DAY-TO-DAY NEEDS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: SUPPORTED LIVING ALTERNATIVESSERVICES ARE AVAILABLE TO INDIVIDUALS WHO LIVE ON THEIR OWN YET NEED SUPPORT TO SUCCEED IN THE COMMUNITY. TO HELP PEOPLE LIVE THEIR LIVES AS INDEPENDENTLY AS POSSIBLE, ROI PROVIDES ASSISTANCE WHICH IS TAILORED TO EACH INDIVIDUAL'S NEEDS, DESIRES, AND SITUATION.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: AUTISM TREATMENTGREAT LAKES CENTER FOR AUTISM TREATMENT & RESEARCH PROVIDES CHILDREN WITH EVIDENCE-BASED APPLIED BEHAVIOR ANALYSIS (ABA) TREATMENT. THERAPY FOCUSES ON THE MEASUREMENT AND ANALYSIS OF BEHAVIOR. BY OBSERVING THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN A CHILD'S ACTIONS AND ENVIRONMENT, BOARD CERTIFIED BEHAVIOR ANALYSTS CAN LEARN HOW THE CHILD REACTS AND INTERACTS, AND HELP TEACH BETTER SKILLS. CHILDREN AT THE CENTER RECEIVE EITHER INTENSIVE TREATMENT IN A RESIDENTIAL SETTING (UP TO EIGHTEEN MONTHS) OR SPECIALIZED OUTPATIENT THERAPY.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: ADDITIONAL SUPPORTS FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES INCLUDE AFFORDABLE HOUSING, REPRESENTATIVE PAYEE SERVICES, AND THE INDEPENDENCE FUND WHICH PROVIDES FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS SERVED BY ROI.

OtherAssetsOrgGrp.Desc: BENEFICIAL INTEREST HELD AT KALAMAZOO COMMUNITY FOUNDATION

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SOCIAL SECURITY ADMINISTRATION HAS DESIGNATED ROI AS REP PAYEE FOR OVER 230 INDIVIDUALS. ROI IS RESPONSIBLE FOR MANAGING THE INDIVIDUALS' BENEFITS IN A WAY THAT THEIR BASIC NEEDS ARE MET.
THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR SUSTAINABLE OPERATIONS.

DBA: GREAT LAKES CENTER FOR AUTISM TREATMENT & RESEARCH DBA: GREAT LAKES CENTER DBA: HEERSMA AUTISM CENTER DBA: LAWRENCE AUTISM CENTER DBA: GREAT LAKES AUTISM CENTER DBA: THE HEERSMA CLINIC DBA: GLCATR

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AUTHORITY FOR FINAL APPROVAL OF THE FORM 990 WAS GRANTED TO THE FINANCE COMMITTEE BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IN 2011. DRAFT COPIES ARE DISTRIBUTED TO THE COMMITTEE; AFTER A THOROUGH REVIEW BY THE CEO, CFO, AND COMMITTEE THE 990 IS APPROVED AND FILED. ONCE APPROVED THE 990 IS MADE AVAILABLE TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND PROCEDURES REQUIRES ALL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS TO ANNUALLY COMPLETE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE AND COMMIT TO REPORTING ANY POTENTIAL NEW CONFLICTS OF INTEREST TO THE FULL BOARD, SHOULD ANY ARISE. BOARD MEMBERS ABSTAIN FROM VOTING ON ANY MATTER WHERE THERE IS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST. ADDITIONALLY, ALL STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS ARE EXPECTED TO SELF-REPORT, ALTHOUGH, SOMETIMES SUPERVISORS OR CO-WORKERS MAY REPORT ANOTHER STAFF'S POTENTIAL CONFLICT. ONCE REPORTED, ALL CONFLICTS ARE REPORTED TO THE COO, WHO DETERMINES WHETHER AN ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICT EXISTS. CONFIRMED CONFLICTS ARE THEN MANAGED VIA A CONFLICTS MANAGEMENT PLAN, WHICH IS SIGNED BY THE STAFF, THE DIRECT SUPERVISOR, THE DIRECTOR, AND THE COO. EXAMPLES OF RESTRICTIONS WHICH MAY BE PUT IN PLACE INCLUDE: STAFF AGREEING TO PRIORITIZE HOURS WORKED FOR ROI OVER HOURS WORKED ELSEWHERE; AND STAFF BEING EXCLUDED FROM WORKING AT PROGRAM SITES WHERE A CLOSE PERSONAL RELATIONSHIP EXISTS BETWEEN THE STAFF AND EITHER AN INCUMBENT STAFF OR AN INDIVIDUAL SERVED AT THE EXCLUDED PROGRAM SITE. THE MANAGEMENT PLAN IS IMPLEMENTED AND MONITORED BY THE STAFF'S DIRECT SUPERVISOR. IF THE COO HAS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST IT IS MANAGED BY THE CEO.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION PROCESS FOR TOP OFFICIAL: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS USES COMPARABLE WAGES OF NONPROFIT CEOS IN THE AREA AND INDUSTRY STANDARDS TO DETERMINE THE WAGE OFFERED TO THE CEO. COMPENSATION PROCESS FOR OFFICERS: THE COO AND CFO WAGES ARE DETERMINED ON A PROGRESSIVE SCALE WHICH GRANTS A TWO PERCENT INCREASE ON THEIR EMPLOYMENT ANNIVERSARY. THE WAGE SCALE IS BASED ON COMPARABLE WAGES OF NONPROFIT EXECUTIVES IN THE AREA AND INDUSTRY STANDARDS. THE PROCESS IS UNDERTAKEN ANNUALLY AND WAS COMPLETED IN FISCAL YEAR 2018.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DOCUMENTS OPEN FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
NO CHANGE IN THE PROCESS HAS BEEN MADE FROM PRIOR YEAR.

THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS FOR RESIDENTIAL OPPORTUNITIES, INC. AND AFFILIATES INCLUDES SIX ORGANIZATIONS UNDER COMMON CONTROL. FIVE OF THOSE ORGANIZATIONS ARE INCLUDED IN A GROUP EXEMPTION AND ARE LISTED ON SCHEDULE R, PART II.
